related-activity.ref: 0240/A0/05/881 PR 1: SOCIAL INCLUSION & CHILD RIGHT MON

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: UNICEF has consolidated its role as a leading actor on child-poverty: it has positioned multidimensional measurement on the public policy agenda, it has called the attention on the effects of the economic crisis on children and the need to strengthen the investment in response and has set the topic in the center of the national electoral agenda. Research findings and technical assistance continued to inform the Universal Child Allowance's reform plan including the debate on conditions. Active search operations co-led by UNICEF included in 2019 over 10,100 children from vulnerable communities under programme coverage, reaching over 32.800 throughout the CPD. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2019

title.narrative: 1.1 National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures

baseline.value: Bienestar y pobreza de nias, nios y adolescentes en Argentina at national level

actual.value: 2019:Consensus around the need for a multidimensional measurement, including request to add some questions to MICS to have the necessary information as baseline for the SDG. Qualitative research to analyze the effects of the economic situation on children and adolescents provided a platform for children

title.narrative: Number of studies and evaluations conducted that orient social protection programs and policies.
